content.description: This has a great overhanging start with solid holds.  Over the ledge, you will work your way up a crack, make a big reach, and finish with a bit of a face climb...super fun!
content.location: This is the 4th route from the right on the Eagle Wall.  It is the route just to the right of the classic, flat roof just outside of the arete.

content.description: This is a very fun climb.  The move onto the arete is probably the crux.  It has great overhanging parts with positive hand holds. It is worth climbing! Rope drag is bad though when top roping.
content.location: It is the farthest route on the right.

content.description: Start up overhanging rock and move up to a dihedral and slanting hand crack.
content.location:
It is between

Scarpa Diem

and

Top Rope 5.10

.

content.description: Climb 30' up broken ledges and a corner system placing a small 0.3 or 0.4 cam in the corner crack and then a #2 cam in the roof and surmount the roof to a large ledge. Clip the 1st bolt and make crimpy and balanced footwork moves to clip the 2nd bolt and move left and up to larger holds. Climb the left side of the face past two more bolts to chains on anchors. This is a great mixed route.
content.protection: A few cams in the #0.3-2 range (a #0.3 and #2 work well), a few slings with biners, and 4 quickdraws for the 4 bolts.
content.location: This is the far left route of Eagle Wall. Locate obvious corner system to ledge and bolts on a face.
